headline: KHC Q1 Earnings Call: Lowered Guidance Amid Declining Volumes and Elevated Investment
summary: Packaged foods company Kraft Heinz (NASDAQ:KHC) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q1 CY2025, but sales fell by 6.4% year on year to $6 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.62 per share was 3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: This Warren Buffett Holding Is Worth Avoiding Despite Its High Yield. Here's Why.
summary: This investment has been a serial disappointment for Berkshire Hathaway.  The best option for generating shareholder value is to improve return on assets by being more productive rather than trying to increase revenue.  Kraft Heinz (NASDAQ: KHC) is one of Berkshire Hathaway's most significant holdings, with a current value of $9.1 billion, representing 3.3% of its equity portfolio.

headline: Shelf-Stable Food Stocks Q1 In Review: Kraft Heinz (NASDAQ:KHC) Vs Peers
summary: Let’s dig into the relative performance of Kraft Heinz (NASDAQ:KHC) and its peers as we unravel the now-completed Q1 shelf-stable food earnings season.
